steps: Soak rice and dal separately for 4-6 hours.
Grind soaked ingredients to make a smooth batter.
Ferment the batter overnight.
Add salt, pour batter onto a hot tawa, and cook to make dosa.

Sauté tomatoes and spices, then add the mashed vegetables.

cooking_questions.what is the best way to cook rice?: The best way to cook rice is to use the absorption method. Use a 2:1 ratio of water to rice, bring it to a boil, then cover and simmer on low heat until the water is absorbed.
cooking_questions.how can I make my cake fluffy?: To make your cake fluffy, ensure you cream the butter and sugar well, and don't overmix the batter once you've added the flour.
cooking_questions.why are my cookies too hard?: If your cookies are hard, you may have baked them too long or added too much flour. Try reducing baking time or checking your measurements.
cooking_questions.how to keep herbs fresh for longer?: Store herbs in the fridge with their stems in water, covered loosely with a plastic bag, to keep them fresh for up to a week.
cooking_questions.why is my pasta sticking together?: To prevent pasta from sticking, stir it often in the first few minutes of cooking and use plenty of water.
